description:
This course will take the student through the basics of visual development: from visual storytelling to character design; from creatures to vehicles. Beginning with simple visual elements, the student will learn how to create images that tell a story visually, as well as support a production in animation, live action, and video games.

                                            Syllabus
                        Session 1: Visual Components In this session we will analyze the visual components that form the basis for all images.Session 2: Pushing The Design Of The Character This session will cover finishing a character design.Session 3: Creature Design In this session, you will learn how a creature can be envisioned and designed.Session 4: Anatomy, Story And Creature Design This session will cover finishing a creature design.Session 5: Creating An Environment In this session you will learn how to create a believable environment in which to stage a character.Session 6: Moving The Eye Of The Viewer This session will cover finishing an environmental design.Session 7: Vehicle Design In this session you will learn how to employ shape to create a successful vehicle design.
title: Visual Storytelling: Envisioning a Narrative for Film and Video Games
